column5: Was wondering if anyone has tried using spiderwire fusion as a leader as opposed to wire? It is pretty tough stuff which is hard to cut with a knife/scissors. I was considering using it with soft plastic jerkbaits when I go to L.S. next Saturday. Would appreciate any input. Thanks in advance!

Not sure about Fusion but I have used Fireline in various diameters and the pike have no problem cutting through it. I think I should just keep a pike in the tackel box for when I need to cut that line. They work better than a scissors!
I find that Fusion and Fireline both are cut by pike and musky teeth easier than traditional mono. Have you considered making leaders out of flourocarbon?
